intro: Centropogon urubambae, commonly known as the Urubamba chuchundra, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
